item.title: Excessive animal mess, 23rd June
item.description:
Number 10 Hamilton walk gave approx 20 cats, and I think three dogs, and the residents are always hosing down there garden, and all the mess is being washed into the pathway and parking area, and the smell is always travelling into others gardens and houses. This has been going on for over 6 months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hamilton Walk, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lift for odd floors malfunctions., 23rd June
item.description:
Lift door open and closes constantly, then goes out of service and starts ringing the alarm. Then works normally and repeats this many times during the day and night, sometimes the alarms goes off at 3 AM...
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cropley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings all worn away, 23rd June
item.description:
Tunnel avenue needs the road markings refreshing, almost all the 20 paint has worn away and there aren't enough signs to let drivers know the speed. Cars fly down the road and over the speed humps at dangerous speeds for a family, residential road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Tunnel Avenue, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every day something "new" appears thrown into the trash heap!, 23rd June
item.description:
This problem has been going on for more than 6 months now, and the blame is being thrown around because it is private land, all of us who live here pay taxes and I think we deserve to live like normal people, not like in a slum on the outskirts of Birmingham. Pampers, food are being thrown away. There is a danger of illness in my opinion of great risk, not to mention all the children who play around it or the people who pass by the same garbage dump every day realizing that from one day to the next "someone" throws something... Please take measures for the health of the people who live here! Install cameras, talk to the owner of the land to do something with you. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bertrand Way, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5 abandoned lime bikes, 23rd June
item.description:
Limes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24-25, Crescent Way, Ladywell, London

item.title: Bollard Stolen. NEEDS URGENT REPLACEMENT, 23rd June
item.description:
It has been over 2 months now that the metal bollard on macfarland grove se15 6hx has not be replaced and secured with a padlock. urgent attention is needed. this is next to the grove family centre on towermill road. also the brickwork to the bollards needs re-laying as it is uneven and weeds and grass are coming through. photos are attached. Cars are now driving through macfarland grove and kids are playing football using the other bollards as goal posts. parked cars in the permit areas are being damaged. We seek your urgent action to replace the missing bollard and attach a padlock that only emergency services can operate. Your help and urgent assistance is highly appreciated in this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham Grove, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please clear it away, 23rd June
item.description:
This is a second request/report! How long until you guys will pick this up?! Southwark cleaning team passes by this corner on daily basis number of times but doesn’t use their common sense to clear it away 🙄

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colegrove Road, Peckham, London
